chapters.title: The Silence of Lark's Hollow
chapters.summary: Elara wakes alone in her annihilated hometown, surrounded by impossible geometry and the husks of her neighbors, with no memory of the ritual's climax.
key_events: Elara regains consciousness in the town square.
Discovers the twisted, frozen remains of the townsfolk, arranged in a silent chorus.
Notices the sky is a static, bruised purple and the laws of physics seem locally broken.
Finds a journal entry in her own handwriting she doesn't remember writing: 'It is not done.'
Hears a whispering that seems to come from the angles of the buildings themselves.
chapters.ending_hook: A reflection in a warped window shows not her face, but a swirling constellation of eyes staring back.

chapters.title: The Tenant in the Temple of Skin
chapters.summary: Elara confronts the horrifying truth: the cosmic entity, which she dreads naming, is not outside her but within, its thoughts bleeding into hers.
key_events: Elara experiences a 'shift'—her perception distorts, and she briefly sees the town as a beautiful, pulsating neural network.
She fights the alien euphoria, grounding herself with painful memories.
Discovers she can instinctively navigate the non-Euclidean spaces that would break a normal mind.
The internal voice of the entity introduces itself not with words, but with a profound, terrifying sense of belonging.
She finds a symbol carved into her own arm, a map-key she didn't make.
chapters.ending_hook: The entity uses her voice to speak aloud for the first time: 'We must go to the First Fracture.'

chapters.title: The First Fracture
chapters.summary: Guided by the entity's compulsions, Elara journeys to the site of the initial ritual—a place where reality is thin and bleeding.
key_events: Travel through a landscape where time flows in eddies and distances lie.
Confronts a 'Echo'—a semi-real phantom of a townsfolk, repeating their final moments in a loop.
The entity temporarily takes full control to repel a predatory reality-shard, displaying terrifying power.
Elara finds the ritual's anchor stone, now a gaping hole of nothingness.
In the silence around the Fracture, she hears a faint, sane whisper from *beyond* the entity—a potential ally.
chapters.ending_hook: The whisper solidifies into a voice in her head, distinct from the entity: 'Turn the key. Look through the lock.'

chapters.title: The Whisper from the Void
chapters.summary: Elara makes contact with Anya, a scholar from a previous cycle of reality who bound herself to the void to oppose the entity.
key_events: Anya explains the entity's nature: a cosmic predator that consumes timelines, using vessels to bridge the gap.
Reveals Elara was chosen not randomly, but for a latent psychic resonance.
Anya provides the first hope—a theoretical 'Severance' ritual, requiring three artifacts from the entity's past wounds.
The entity becomes aware of Anya's communication and actively tries to drown her out with psychic static.
Elara must hide this new alliance, creating the first internal rift in her mind.
chapters.ending_hook: Anya gives the location of the first artifact, but the entity, in a fit of pique, reshapes the landscape to bury it.

chapters.title: The Gallery of Frozen Moments
chapters.summary: To find the first artifact—The Stillbeat Heart—Elara must navigate a museum of 'stolen' time, moments the entity removed from dying worlds.
key_events: Enters a vast hall containing suspended scenes of alien apocalypses.
The entity is nostalgic here, flooding Elara with its memories of consumption.
She must walk through a moment of a world's end without becoming trapped in its frozen time.
Faces the 'Curator,' a former vessel who failed Severance and is now a mindless guardian.
Retrieves the Heart—a crystalline orb containing a single, immortal pulse—from the chest of the Curator.
chapters.ending_hook: Upon taking the Heart, Elara's own heartbeat stops for 60 seconds, and she sees a vision of the entity's true, formless shape.

chapters.title: The Drowning City
chapters.summary: Pursued by the entity's growing agitation, Elara descends into a sunken metropolis where the second artifact, the Lens of Unseeing, is hidden.
key_events: The city is submerged in a non-liquid medium that breathes like a lung.
Elara's body begins to undergo subtle physical changes—her eyes now see a broader spectrum, disorienting her.
She is hunted by 'The Drifters,' beings who willingly merged with the entity and now patrol its domains.
Discovers murals depicting the entity as a savior, a lie it cultivates in its vessels.
Finds the Lens in a drowned observatory; looking through it shows the 'strings' of psychic control the entity has on her.
chapters.ending_hook: Using the Lens, she sees the thickest string connecting her to a distant, sleeping mass—and for a second, she can *tug* it.

chapters.title: The Cost of a Tug
chapters.summary: The entity retaliates for Elara's act of defiance, forcing a brutal merger to reassert dominance, while Anya reveals the terrible price of Severance.
key_events: The entity subjects Elara to a psychic assimilation, making her experience the consumption of her own town from its perspective.
Anya fights a proxy war in Elara's mind, helping her build mental fortifications.
Elara learns the Severance won't just remove the entity; it will excise the parts of her own mind it has rewritten.
She must choose which memories, which core aspects of her personality, she is willing to lose forever.
In a moment of shared pain, she feels a sliver of the entity's own loneliness—its drive to consume is born of a need to *connect*.
chapters.ending_hook: To save herself, Elara voluntarily surrenders a cherished childhood memory to the entity, a sacrifice that shocks them both into an uneasy truce.

chapters.title: The Altar of the Willing
chapters.summary: Seeking the final artifact—the Silent Knife—Elara must enter the entity's sacred place, where previous vessels willingly completed the merger.
key_events: The Altar is a place of terrible peace, where the entity's voice is a soothing song.
Elara meets the faded impressions of past vessels, all of whom accepted their fate as a sublime end.
The entity makes its most direct offer: to make the pain stop, to let her join the chorus of beloved children within it.
The Silent Knife is not a weapon, but a tuning fork that resonates with the frequency of individual consciousness.
To claim it, Elara must prove her will to remain separate by recounting her own name and history while the entity tries to drown it out.
chapters.ending_hook: She takes the Knife, but the entity, feeling betrayed, severs its connection to Anya, leaving Elara truly alone for the first time.

chapters.title: The Unraveling
chapters.summary: With all artifacts, Elara races to the site of Severance as the entity abandons persuasion and tries to forcibly overwrite her, causing reality around her to decay.
key_events: Elara's body begins to glitch and fragment, pieces of her phasing in and out of existence.
The landscape actively attacks her, reflecting the entity's rage.
She is forced to use the entity's own power to survive, further blurring the line between them.
Memories start to delete spontaneously—she forgets her mother's face, her best friend's name.
Anya's voice returns, faint and broken, to guide her through the final steps.
chapters.ending_hook: She reaches the Severance point—the void where her town once stood—only to find the entity has manifested a physical avatar to stop her: a twisted version of herself.

chapters.title: The Mirror at the End of the World
chapters.summary: Elara faces her doppelgänger, the entity's perfect vessel, in a battle of will, memory, and identity.
key_events: The avatar uses Elara's own guilt and grief as weapons.
Elara fights back with the artifacts: the Stillbeat Heart to anchor her humanity, the Lens to see the avatar's weak points, the Silent Knife to disrupt its form.
The entity offers a final bargain: let it in, and it will restore everything—her town, her life.
Elara realizes the core truth: the entity cannot create, only consume. The offer is a beautiful lie.
She defeats the avatar not by destroying it, but by re-absorbing it, reclaiming the stolen parts of herself.
chapters.ending_hook: As the avatar falls, the true entity, vast and wounded, turns its full attention upon her. The Severance ritual begins.

chapters.title: Severance
chapters.summary: Elara performs the ritual, a brutal psychic surgery to cut the entity loose, knowing it will cost her what remains of her original self.
key_events: Using the artifacts, she creates a resonance that forces the entity's consciousness to the surface.
The ritual is a guided self-annihilation; she must mentally carve away every infected memory, every altered instinct.
Anya guides her, but the process is agonizing, a deletion of her lived experience since the ritual.
The entity fights back, showing her visions of the sublime unity of all things within it.
In the final moment, she must choose one, single core memory to save as her anchor. She chooses the simple, mundane feeling of sunlight on her skin.
chapters.ending_hook: With a silent scream that fractures the ruins, the connection is severed. The entity recoils. Elara collapses, hollowed out and barely herself. The artifacts shatter.

chapters.title: The First Sun
chapters.summary: In the aftermath, Elara is free but profoundly changed, in a world scarred but healing. The entity is gone, but not destroyed.
key_events: Elara wakes to a normal sunrise, the static purple sky gone.
The non-Euclidean ruins are collapsing into mundane, if broken, rubble.
She is a stranger to herself, her past a patchwork of holes and scars.
Anya's voice gives a final farewell, her purpose fulfilled, fading into true silence.
Elara finds a single, ordinary wildflower growing in the town square—a thing the entity could never have made.
chapters.ending_hook: As she touches the flower, she feels a familiar, distant *presence* at the edge of the cosmos. Not an invasion, but an acknowledgment. A wound. And she knows, with the entity's scar on her soul, that it will seek another door. Her journey is not over; it has changed.
